answers.answer: I can't give you exact treatment for canine thyroid cancer but I have human thyroid cancer so maybe it will help.  Needle biopsies are notorious for giving false results of thyroid cancer.  Often the cancer is so small that the needle misses it completely.  For humans, the best treatment is to remove the thyroid then go on thyroid replacement hormones.   My dachshund was on them before he passed (from diabetes) and they are no big deal to give your dog.With humans, if it is cancer then the treatment is radioactive iodine.  The thyroid is the only tissue that absorbs iodine so the radioactive iodine therapy targets just the thyroid and thyroid cancer.  No nasty chemo side effects.  But that is for humans - I'm not sure if the same treatment is available for dogs.Your greyhound's heart problems are probably either caused by, or are contributed to by, the thyroid problems.  Thyroid conditions are notorious for causing high blood pressure, heart palpitations, etc.Has she had her thyroid levels checked?  It sounds like she is hyperthyroid.Hope some of this helps.  My best to you and your wonderful dog.
